channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024020436
item.description:
Report X-2024020436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IN THE UNLOAD, THE HAZMAT WAS UNLOADED FROM THE TRAILER AND SLAMMED INTO THE ROLLERS CAUSING ONE OF THE ECOLAB BOTTLES TO UNSCREW AND SPILL. DescribePack: DURING THE INSPECTION, ONE OF THE BOTTLE CAPS WERE LOOSE DUE TO IMPROPER HANDLING CAUSING THE BOX TO RIP OPEN. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGE HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN A SAFETY CONTAINER TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING WET.

item.title: Report X-2024020500
item.description:
Report X-2024020500

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ON THE 23RD OF JANAUARY, THE DRIVER BROUGHT BACK THE HAZMAT TO THE TERMINAL AFTER NOTICING A LEAK. ONE OF THE PACKAGE HANDLERS MUST'VE TOSSED AND SLAMMED THE PACKAGE ON THE TRUCK. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CORROSIVE LIQUIDS HAD A SMALL LEAK UNDER THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGE HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN SAFETY CONTAINER TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING WET

item.title: Report X-2024020154
item.description:
Report X-2024020154

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Jan 29th, DG Admin was contacted about a package that comes from a known DG shipper that has shipped undeclared DG in the past. DG Admin advised the box to be opened and it contained UN1202 Gas Oil, 3, PGIII. The package was not marked or labeled as DG, nor was there a shippers dec with the shipment. The package was held, and then released by the FAA on Jan 30th. The shipper was contacted to pick up the shipment.

item.title: Report I-2024100059
item.description:
Report I-2024100059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: Petersburg
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/5/24 at approximately 10:00 AM, Operators were loading ethanol from railcar MUI-X 730192 into Petroleum Carriers trailer 9301. While loading a scheduled 1400 gallons into compartment 2(capacity 2500 gallons), product was released from the overflow tubes at the rear of the trailer. The pump meter read 1272 gallons at the time of the release. An estimated 100 gallons impacted the asphalt. Product evaporated, there is no cleanup material to be disposed of. All appropriate personnel were notified of the incident. Overfill protection on the pump was disabled by the loaders. Driver failed to advise loaders that there was product remaining in the compartment being loaded.

item.title: Report E-2024020027
item.description:
Report E-2024020027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: LYNCHBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: We have a procedure called the 'Safe 8' that requires the drivers to go through a series of 8 steps to ensure that will help ensure no product spills out when they remove the main discharge cap. This driver did not follow the process as trained so when he uncapped 5 gallons or less spilled out in to the parking lot.
